introduction: The video provides an overview of building a job board app as a real startup. The app will start with a single data feed from a job board API and use React and Material UI for the frontend. The backend will use an Express server and Redis for data storage. The app will filter jobs and eventually include more complex features such as searching by years of experience.

sections.title: Section 1: Setting up the Frontend
content: Creating a new React app in the 'junior dev' folder.
Installing Material UI and using it for styling the app.
Defining a new component for jobs and a single job row.
Creating a job list component that maps jobs from the API and adds CSS styling.

sections.title: Section 2: Setting up the Backend
content: Creating a new Express server.
Using Redis for data storage.
Defining a new component for jobs and a single job row.
Creating a job list component that maps jobs from the API and adds CSS styling.

sections.title: Section 3: Filtering Jobs
content: Defining an algorithm to filter jobs based on seniority and managerial roles.
Incorporating the algorithm into the app to filter jobs.
Testing and refining the filtering process.
Exploring the possibility of searching by years of experience.

sections.title: Section 4: Deployment
content: Deploying the app to a virtual private server.
Configuring Nginx and SSL certificates for security.
Finalizing the app for production readiness.
Live deployment and testing of the job board app.

sections.title: Section 5: Future Development
content: Expanding the app to include multiple job board APIs.
Incorporating more complex features such as searching by years of experience.
Creating search indexes and other advanced features.
Continuously improving the app based on user feedback.
